questions.question_text: How are MAC addresses removed from a MAC address table?

choices.C: They must be manually cleared from the table.
choices.A: They are removed automatically if they remain inactive for the duration of the switch aging timer.
choices.B: They are removed automatically on a FIFO basis when the address-table limit has been reached.
choices.D: They are removed automatically if they remain inactive for the duration of the global MAC address timer.

discussion.content:
mac address-table aging-time
To configure the aging time for entries in the MAC address table, use the mac address-table aging-time command. To return to the default settings, use the no form of this command.
It's not clear if it is A or D ... Maybe the given answers are not 100% accurate?
The right answer is A. The counter is the aging time.

questions.question_text: Which IPv6 address does a device use for neighbor discovery?

discussion.content: Isn't the answer supposed to be B. Multicast address?!

Is this question missing information ? ... 
If you look at a Neighbor Solictaion Message ... the senders adress can be any configured ipv6 adress ... So it can be a global unicast address (like in Ciscos iPv6 Example, ip v6 fudnamentals page 164) but ND must also work with link local adresses ... 
If the question only referes to the Destiantion Adresse this should be a Multicast address ... but thats unclear

questions.question_text: Which static route can be used to forward a packet that is destined to 192.168.1.23?
Which type of route is the most trusted?

choices.A: Change the OSPF administrative distance to 5.
choices.D: Change the RIP administrative distance to 100.
choices.B: Change the RIP administrative distance to 70.
choices.C: Change the EIGRP administrative distance to 70.
choices.E: Change the EIGRP administrative distance to 100. AB

questions.question_text: All protocols on a network are using their default administrative distances with no redistribution. In which two different ways can you modify them so that OSPF and RIPv2 learned routes are preferred over EIGRP-learned routes? (Choose two.)
